meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Julie Reynolds Joey Gutmann Paula Menasche Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6513.

td.p: Julie Reynolds, a medical transcriptionist from Waterville, Ohio
Joey Gutmann, a law student from New York, New York
Paula Menasche, a high school social studies teacher from Coral Gables, Florida (whose 3-day cash winnings total $55,100)

tr.td: 1920s NEWS FLASH!
A CATEGORY WITH A TWIST
CAPITAL CITY CHURCHES
(Alex: We'll give you the church. You tell us the capital city in which it is located.)
THE GAME'S A "FOOT"
SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS
GOLDEN GLOBE WINNERS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'News flash! This less-than-yappy pappy is sixth veep to be nation\'s top dog after chief takes deep sleep!')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: News flash! This less-than-yappy pappy is sixth veep to be nation's top dog after chief takes deep sleep!

tr.td: Paula
Joey

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Paula
Joey
Julie
THE 6 SIMPLE MACHINES
(Alex: We only have five clues in the category, so we'll have five of them.)
PALINDROMIC WORDS
BRITANNICA BIOS: "A"
THE QUOTABLE KEATS
GREEK FOOD & DRINK
BROADWAY LYRICS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_1_1', 'clue_DJ_1_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew uses a nutcracker to open a walnut.) It may not look like it, but a nutcracker is actually a type of this simple machine, with the arms connected to a fulcrum, helping to amplify physical force')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew uses a nutcracker to open a walnut.) It may not look like it, but a nutcracker is actually a type of this simple machine, with the arms connected to a fulcrum, helping to amplify physical force
